channel.title: Sig
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/s6jeB.png[/img]
first sig made in years so i'm rusty as fuck. made with GIMP, C&C appreciated.

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I hope your not actually using this? lol jk >.<
Looks good for a first attempt keep it up!

Read full topic

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @Dean313 Dean313
item.description:
@Dean313 wrote:

It kinda just looks like you slapped on a render with a background. The colors don’t really match.

Read full topic

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Would go better with the black version, ezio in altair’s armor

Read full topic

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:13, topic:446281”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=549144.msg4025845#msg4025845 date=1340322372]
I figured you had duplicated and reduced the fractals opacity (probably because I did that for SoTW ). The effect looks nice, but it just has to go along with the render. With this fractal, a render of a flaming entity would definitely go better, such as The Human Torch or something along those lines. For this render you’re using though, maybe this fractal will work, provided I cahnge up the colors a bit.

I could also see you geting creative with this one:

[/quote]hm, those are nice, thanks, i’ll tinker with them sometime.[/quote]as will i.

Read full topic

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:

[quote=“rip4d, post:12, topic:446281”]I figured you had duplicated and reduced the fractals opacity (probably because I did that for SoTW ). The effect looks nice, but it just has to go along with the render. With this fractal, a render of a flaming entity would definitely go better, such as The Human Torch or something along those lines. For this render you’re using though, maybe this fractal will work, provided I cahnge up the colors a bit.

I could also see you geting creative with this one:
http://th07.deviantart.net/fs70/PRE/f/2011/069/3/a/beaming_power_by_ddsp11-d3bbe4j.jpg[/quote]hm, those are nice, thanks, i’ll tinker with them sometime.

Read full topic

I figured you had duplicated and reduced the fractals opacity (probably because I did that for SoTW ). The effect looks nice, but it just has to go along with the render. With this fractal, a render of a flaming entity would definitely go better, such as The Human Torch or something along those lines. For this render you’re using though, maybe this fractal will work, provided I cahnge up the colors a bit.

I could also see you geting creative with this one:

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:5, topic:446281”]Looks nice, but kinda simple. If you were going for an effect of Altair/Ezio (whoever the hell he is, I don’t play AC) coming out of fire, you need flames or light around the edges rather than in the center of him. It also looks like you just took some brushes over the render with a fractal background (which looks julia-linear based :s )

Edit: Just saw it was Juggalo’s fractal. Yup, thats his style :P[/quote]thanks, as for the overlay i just duplicated the fractal and reduced the opacity with some masking and a bit of contrast-twiddling. any suggestions as to what i could further do with it?

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:446281”][quote author=s1gma link=topic=549144.msg4025651#msg4025651 date=1340314214]

[quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=549144.msg4025616#msg4025616 date=1340313288]
is the right oval supposed to match the left oval?
[/quote]not particularly, i thought i’d just experiment with dual light sources (they didn’t really turn out that way too well). the fractal is here.

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=549144.msg4025636#msg4025636 date=1340313792]
The render doesn’t really fit in with the background…
[/quote]i was trying to take advantage of the red, white and brown in the render by complementing with brighter reds, oranges and blacks. mind being a bit more specific on what you think?
[/quote]Like it doesn’t feel like it flows well into the background[/quote]hmk

[quote=“rip4d, post:10, topic:446281”][quote author=Krackkid link=topic=549144.msg4025697#msg4025697 date=1340315484]

[quote author=s1gma link=topic=549144.msg4025610#msg4025610 date=1340313125]
so i’m rusty as fuck.
[/quote]Sounds like you need some WD40

But I think a different color would fit better then the bright red imo.
[/quote]This.

Unless you can get the parameters from Juggalo, chances of being able to change the colors to say, white and red, and having it flow the same way the fractal’s color does are very low. You can try color replacement, but it may not turn out as nice as you’d like (I’m picturing the small circles around the outside as a dull pinkish-red and the majority of the rest of the fractal white).[/quote]i guess i could fiddle around with apophysis and try and get something to work, although i could work with finding a render to compliment a good fractal instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Krackkid, post:9, topic:446281”][quote author=s1gma link=topic=549144.msg4025610#msg4025610 date=1340313125]
so i’m rusty as fuck.
[/quote]Sounds like you need some WD40

But I think a different color would fit better then the bright red imo.[/quote]This.

Unless you can get the parameters from Juggalo, chances of being able to change the colors to say, white and red, and having it flow the same way the fractal’s color does are very low. You can try color replacement, but it may not turn out as nice as you’d like (I’m picturing the small circles around the outside as a dull pinkish-red and the majority of the rest of the fractal white).

Read full topic

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:

[quote=“s1gma, post:1, topic:446281”]so i’m rusty as fuck.[/quote]Sounds like you need some WD40

But I think a different color would fit better then the bright red imo.

item.title: Sig
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Looks nice, but kinda simple. If you were going for an effect of Altair/Ezio (whoever the hell he is, I don’t play AC) coming out of fire, you need flames or light around the edges rather than in the center of him. It also looks like you just took some brushes over the render with a fractal background (which looks julia-linear based :s )

Edit: Just saw it was Juggalo’s fractal. Yup, thats his style

Read full topic
